title: How to Make Matzo Ball Soup

steps.headline: Add the beaten eggs, oil, Manischewitz Matzo Meal, and salt into a bowl.
Add the broth, soup, or water and mix until uniform.
Cover and chill in a refrigerator for about 20 minutes.
Bring 6 cups (1,400 ml) salted water to a brisk boil.
Remove the chilled matzo ball mixture from your refrigerator.
Moisten your hands and form the batter into matzo balls approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.
Drop the matzo balls into the pot of boiling water.
Cover tightly and simmer until thoroughly cooked (about 30 to 40 minutes).
Remove the matzo balls from the water.
Serve at room temperature or warmer.
steps.description: If serving in soup, place the matzo balls in a soup pot and allow to simmer in the soup for about 5 minutes or until heated throughly.

text: Add the beaten eggs, oil, Manischewitz Matzo Meal, and salt into a bowl.  Blend them together.  Add the broth, soup, or water and mix until uniform.  Cover and chill in a refrigerator for about 20 minutes.  Bring 6 cups (1,400 ml) salted water to a brisk boil.  Remove the chilled matzo ball mixture from your refrigerator.  Moisten your hands and form the batter into matzo balls approximately 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.  Reduce heat.  Drop the matzo balls into the pot of boiling water.  Cover tightly and simmer until thoroughly cooked (about 30 to 40 minutes).  Remove the matzo balls from the water.  Serve at room temperature or warmer. If serving in soup, place the matzo balls in a soup pot and allow to simmer in the soup for about 5 minutes or until heated throughly.
